alert.note: Alert for Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 3:07PM EDT until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Florida, including the following county, Duval. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. It may take several hours for all the water from these showers and storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 302 PM EDT, observations in the area show 2 to as much as 3 inches have fallen since last night. Another batch of rain is headed toward the area this afternoon. Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville and Riverside. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
